sources.data_found: Department of Computer Science About Us: 'Enrollment has grown to over 1700 undergraduate majors... and over 230 graduate students.'

student_data.notes: Official department 'About Us' page states enrollment is 'over 1700 undergraduate majors' and 'over 230 graduate students'. The specific breakdown between MS and PhD is not explicitly stated on the overview page; counts here are estimated based on the total (230) and typical public university CS department ratios (~65% MS / ~35% PhD) to satisfy the schema requirement.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Listed in Sapelo2 Hardware Overview: 13 nodes with 2x K80 GPUs each.

gpu_resources.notes: Counts derived from GACRC Sapelo2 Wiki Hardware Overview. A100 80GB Calculation: 10 nodes x 2 GPUs + 1 node x 4 GPUs + 1 node x 8 GPUs = 32 A100 80GB GPUs. V100 Calculation: 4 nodes x 4 GPUs + 2 nodes x 4 GPUs = 24 V100 GPUs. P100 Calculation: 4 nodes x 4 GPUs + 1 node x 2 GPUs = 18 P100 GPUs. K80 Calculation: 13 nodes x 2 GPUs = 26 GPUs. Data reflects the Sapelo2 cluster managed by GACRC (Georgia Advanced Computing Resource Center).

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI and Gemini models. OpenAI was unable to retrieve live data due to environment restrictions; values derive from Gemini findings regarding Sapelo2 cluster and CS department enrollment pages.
